{"step_by_step_thinking": "The gingival sheath is a part of the gum that surrounds the teeth. When preparing it for a procedure, the shape of the wedge used is important. The wedge is used to retract the gingival tissue and provide access to the tooth. A triangular wedge is typically used because it can be inserted with minimal trauma to the tissue and provides good retraction.", "answer_choice": "B. Triangular"}
